intro: Ceanothus ophiochilus, commonly known as the golden ceanothus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and inland areas, often in well-drained soils. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces showy, blue to purple flowers in the spring. It is part of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
